news_summary: Bulgaria's official entry as the 21st eurozone member marks a significant step toward greater European economic integration and stability.
news_summary_fr: L'entrée officielle de la Bulgarie en tant que 21e membre de la zone euro marque une étape importante vers une plus grande intégration économique et une plus grande stabilité en Europe.

articles.title: Bulgaria is now officially the 21st member of the eurozone
articles.summary: This happens 19 years after the country's accession to the European Union
articles.content:
SOFIA – Bulgaria has officially been the 21st member of the euro area since 1 January 2026 – 19 years after the country’s accession to the European Union (EU). This became possible after the Council of the EU voted unanimously on 8 July 2025 on the final decisions related to the adoption of the euro in Bulgaria. With this, the procedure was completed, after earlier the same day the European Parliament also approved by a large majority the report on the introduction of the single European currency by Bulgaria.

The Governor of the Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) becomes a member of the Governing Council of the European Central Bank (ECB) with voting rights, and the Bulgarian Minister of Finance joins the Eurogroup – the informal body in which the finance ministers of the countries whose currency is the euro participate.

I warmly welcome Bulgaria to the euro family and the Governor of the BNB Dimitar Radev to the table of the ECB Governing Council in Frankfurt, said Christine Lagarde, President of the ECB.

The introduction of the euro is the last milestone in Bulgaria’s integration into the European Union – a place that is due to us thanks to the achievements of our millennia-old culture and the civilizational contribution of our country, said the President of Bulgaria Rumen Radev in his New Year’s address.

For Bulgaria, 2026 is a turning point, because it marks the full membership of our country in the euro area, which will allow it to take its rightful place in the common European family, wrote the Speaker of the Bulgarian Parliament Raya Nazaryan on her Facebook profile.

We welcome the New 2026 Year as a member of the euro area – a strategic step that brings greater security, financial stability and more opportunities for citizens and for business, said the Bulgarian caretaker Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov, in a post on the Facebook profile of the Council of Ministers.

I am happy that I had the opportunity to be part of the fulfillment of a dream for generations of Bulgarians, wrote the Bulgarian caretaker Minister of Finance Temenuzhka Petkova on Facebook.

In his address on the eve of 1 January, the Governor of the BNB Dimitar Radev stated that the euro is not just an economic decision and a currency, but “a sign of belonging: that your place is not on the periphery, but in a space of common rules, trust and responsibility; a sign that the effort you have made has been recognized and accepted.” “On the newest European coins it says ‘GOD SAVE BULGARIA’ and that says enough, because Bulgaria is Europe and Europe is Bulgaria,” emphasized the Governor of the BNB.

“Welcome to the euro, Bulgaria,” wrote the President of the European Parliament (EP) Roberta Metsola on her official page as head of the institution in English and Bulgarian.

The transition from lev to euro is more than a change of currency – it places Bulgaria in the heart of Europe, stated the European Commissioner for the Economy Valdis Dombrovskis. According to him, the country has made exceptional efforts to prepare for the euro, and Bulgarians can be proud of this achievement.

Bulgaria’s accession to the euro area is a turning point that reflects sustained efforts and reforms, strengthens our common currency and the shared economic foundations of the European Union at a decisive moment for Europe, said Kyriakos Pierrakakis, Minister of Finance of Greece and President of the Eurogroup, which brings together the finance ministers of the countries of the monetary union.

The European Central Bank will illuminate its main building in Frankfurt every evening until 11 January in honor of Bulgaria’s accession to the euro area, the institution announced on its website.

With a light show and 3D mapping on the BNB building on the night of 31 December 2025 to 1 January 2026, Sofia welcomed the euro.

Until the end of January, the lev will be an equivalent means of payment in Bulgaria, and from 1 February the euro will be the only currency, in accordance with the Law on the Introduction of the Euro in the Republic of Bulgaria. The lev-euro exchange rate is 1.95583 leva for 1 euro, corresponding to the central rate of the lev in the currency board. Until 8 August 2026, however, prices will continue to be displayed in dual form in euro and lev, according to the requirements of the law, in the same font, size and color. (1 January 2026)

articles.personality_title: Bulgaria joins the eurozone as its 21st member
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Bulgaria became a member of the European Union (EU) 19 years ago. Since then, it has worked towards adopting the euro, the EU’s common currency, to strengthen its economy and ties with other member countries.

**What happened** – On January 1, 2026, Bulgaria officially started using the euro as its currency, becoming the 21st country in the eurozone. This followed a unanimous vote by the EU Council in July 2025 and approval by the European Parliament. The Bulgarian National Bank’s governor joined the European Central Bank’s decision-making group, and Bulgaria’s finance minister joined the Eurogroup.

**Impact** – Joining the eurozone means Bulgaria’s money is now part of a shared system with many European countries. This brings more financial stability and security for people and businesses in Bulgaria. It also means Bulgaria is more connected to Europe’s economic decisions and policies, showing it is fully part of the European community.

**What’s next step** – Until the end of January 2026, Bulgaria’s old currency, the lev, will still be accepted alongside the euro. From February 1, 2026, the euro will be the only official currency. Prices will be shown in both lev and euro for a few more months to help people adjust. Bulgaria will continue to take part in European economic discussions and decisions through its representatives.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Bulgaria’s adoption of the euro marks its full integration into the eurozone, bringing new economic stability and closer ties with Europe.
articles.personality_title_fr: La Bulgarie rejoint officiellement la zone euro en tant que 21e membre
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – La Bulgarie a rejoint l'Union européenne (UE) il y a 19 ans. Depuis, elle a travaillé pour adopter l'euro, la monnaie commune de l'UE, afin de renforcer son économie et ses liens avec les autres pays membres.

**Ce qui s'est passé** – Le 1er janvier 2026, la Bulgarie a officiellement commencé à utiliser l'euro comme monnaie, devenant ainsi le 21e pays de la zone euro. Cela fait suite à un vote unanime du Conseil de l'UE en juillet 2025 et à l'approbation du Parlement européen. Le gouverneur de la Banque nationale bulgare a rejoint le groupe de décision de la Banque centrale européenne, et le ministre des Finances bulgare a intégré l'Eurogroupe.

**Impact** – Rejoindre la zone euro signifie que la monnaie bulgare fait désormais partie d'un système partagé avec de nombreux pays européens. Cela apporte plus de stabilité financière et de sécurité pour les citoyens et les entreprises en Bulgarie. Cela signifie aussi que la Bulgarie est plus connectée aux décisions économiques et politiques européennes, montrant qu'elle fait pleinement partie de la communauté européenne.

**Prochaine étape** – Jusqu'à la fin janvier 2026, l'ancienne monnaie bulgare, le lev, sera encore acceptée avec l'euro. À partir du 1er février 2026, l'euro sera la seule monnaie officielle. Les prix seront affichés en lev et en euro pendant quelques mois pour aider les gens à s'adapter. La Bulgarie continuera à participer aux discussions et décisions économiques européennes par ses représentants.

**Conclusion en une phrase** – L’adoption de l’euro par la Bulgarie marque son intégration complète dans la zone euro, apportant une nouvelle stabilité économique et des liens renforcés avec l’Europe.
articles.personality_title_es: Bulgaria se une oficialmente a la eurozona como su 21º miembro
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Bulgaria se unió a la Unión Europea (UE) hace 19 años. Desde entonces, ha trabajado para adoptar el euro, la moneda común de la UE, con el fin de fortalecer su economía y sus vínculos con otros países miembros.

**Qué pasó** – El 1 de enero de 2026, Bulgaria comenzó oficialmente a usar el euro como su moneda, convirtiéndose en el 21º país de la eurozona. Esto siguió a una votación unánime del Consejo de la UE en julio de 2025 y a la aprobación del Parlamento Europeo. El gobernador del Banco Nacional de Bulgaria se unió al grupo de toma de decisiones del Banco Central Europeo, y el ministro de Finanzas de Bulgaria se integró en el Eurogrupo.

**Impacto** – Unirse a la eurozona significa que el dinero de Bulgaria ahora forma parte de un sistema compartido con muchos países europeos. Esto trae más estabilidad financiera y seguridad para las personas y las empresas en Bulgaria. También significa que Bulgaria está más conectada con las decisiones económicas y políticas de Europa, mostrando que forma parte completa de la comunidad europea.

**Próximo paso** – Hasta finales de enero de 2026, la antigua moneda, el lev, seguirá siendo aceptada junto con el euro. A partir del 1 de febrero de 2026, el euro será la única moneda oficial. Los precios se mostrarán en lev y en euro durante algunos meses para ayudar a las personas a adaptarse. Bulgaria seguirá participando en las discusiones y decisiones económicas europeas a través de sus representantes.

**Frase clave** – La adopción del euro por parte de Bulgaria marca su plena integración en la eurozona, trayendo nueva estabilidad económica y vínculos más estrechos con Europa.
